alert.note: Alert for Bosque (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 27 at 11:51PM CDT until October 28 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Bosque County in central Texas... * Until 400 AM CDT. * At 1151 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms continuing to produce heavy rain north of Meridian. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen in and around Meridian. Flash flooding is ongoing in Meridian and areas to the north. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Clifton, Meridian, Laguna Park, Iredell, Cranfills Gap, Meridian State Park, Lake Whitney, Walnut Springs, Morgan, Cedar Shores, Lakewood Harbor, Norse, Eulogy, Lakeside Village, Womack, Kopperl and Brazos Point. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Dangerous flash flooding is occurring or is imminent. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing flood waters. If you are in an area subject to flooding, move to higher ground now. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
